# Multiple Comparison {#sec-model-multicomp}

What do we do after ANOVA? In ANOVA we test

  + <span style="color:blue"> $\begin{align} 
  &H_0: \mu_1 = \mu_2 = \dots = \mu_t\\ 
  &H_1: \mu_i \ne \mu_j \text{ for some } i, j
  \end{align}$ </span>
  
If we reject $H_0$ in favor of $H_1$, then the question arises that for what pairs $\mu_i \ne \mu_j$. Results of an ANOVA do NOT tell us which group(s) is(are) different from the others. 

Now, we want to test

  + <span style="color:blue"> $\begin{align} 
  &H_0^{ij}: \mu_i = \mu_j\\ 
  &H_1^{ij}: \mu_i \ne \mu_j
  \end{align}$ </span> 
  for all pairs of $(i, j)$ using, say, two-sample $t$-test:

We will be testing many hypotheses. For example, if there are 5 treatments, there will be 10 hypotheses. $t_{ij} = \frac{\bar{y}_i - \bar{y}_j}{s_p \sqrt{\left( \frac{1}{n_i} + \frac{1}{n_j} \right)}}$ for all pairs of $(i, j)$.
